name: reignition
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act or process of something starting to burn again: The burner allows automatic ignition and re-ignition. You should to immerse the burned area in water to prevent reignition.
the act of making something such as a disagreement or worry that was disappearing grow stronger again: We want to avoid a reignition of the row about the local schools. After his death there was a re-ignition of interest in his music. Related word
reignite
More examplesFewer examplesWe can expect a re-ignition of the row about who is to blame for failing to excite the voters.The incident caused a reignition of the simmering feud between the two clubs.A notorious gang leader has been murdered in a re-ignition of a long-standing feud.
